tool.name: Tomo Find Center Axis
tool.description: Find the center axis for a tomography reconstruction
tool.command: mkdir find_center_pngs; $__tool_directory__/tomo_find_center.py -i '$red_stacks' -c '$config' --row_bounds $row_bounds.row_bound_low $row_bounds.row_bound_upp --center_rows $recon_centers.lower_row $recon_centers.upper_row #if str( $set.set_selector ) == "yes" --center_type_selector '$set.center_type.center_type_selector' #if str( $set.center_type.center_type_selector ) == "user" --set_center '$set.center_type.set_center' #end if --set_range '$set.set_range' --set_step '$set.set_step' #end if --output_config 'output_config.yaml' -l '$log'

section.name: recon_centers
section.title: Reconstruction rows to establish center axis

param.name: set_selector
param.label: Reconstruct slices for a set of center positions?

param.name: center_type_selector
param.label: Choose the center (C) of the set
param.option: Use the center obtained by Nghia Voâ€™s method
Enter the center of the set

param.name: set_center
param.label: Center (C) of the set in detector pixels (0: center of the detector row)

param.name: set_range
param.label: Half-width (H) of the set ranch in detector pixels

param.name: set_step
param.label: Step size (S) in detector pixels (reconstruct slices for centers at [C-H, C-H+S, ..., C+H])
